intro: Ruellia indigotica, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 feet, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its foliage is often covered in a fine, silvery-white pubescence, giving it a unique texture. Ruellia indigotica is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
